TopicTitle: DROMOMAN - modular arm parts for Infernal Robotics

Articles.Content: hmm does this use the infernal robotics plugin or damned robotics because we i tested with only the newer infernal robotics plugin it wouldn't move

hmm does this use the infernal robotics plugin or damned robotics because we i tested with only the newer infernal robotics plugin it wouldn't move

It's Infernal Robotics only. Need a logfile to know what's going on.

ok to be more specific as to what i mean by don't move is that when i actually launch the dromoman parts, the gui will not show even though it shows in the VAB/SPH even when i have a normal infernal robotics part on.

i should mention that i have over 60 mods installed including toolbar plugin and i will try to get the log file but i just needed to put this first
I was considering the name of the mod a little while ago, shouldn't it be more like.... Infernal RObotics Nodial MANipulator?

I was considering the name of the mod a little while ago, shouldn't it be more like.... Infernal RObotics Nodial MANipulator?

so it would be IRONMAN? hmm dang i can't think of an acronym that will form IRONY for this

Edited January 4, 2014 by Helix935

so it would be IRONMAN? hmm dang i can't think of an acronym that will form IRONY for this

Infernal RObotics Node Y..anker ... ?

Infernal RObotics Node Y..anker ... ?

That's the IRONY part (yet to be invented) that lets an arm do the inchworm thing.
Does this still work for 0.23?

Does this still work for 0.23?

With infernal robotics, yes.
Awesome; a crane for KSP. I've been wanting one for SO long. Downloading now!
Anyone Have a .zip download of build 2?

For anyone who wants the DROMOMAN parts added to the tech tree:

Get the latest module manager dll and make a new cfg file and paste the following in it:

@PART[DROMOMAN_*]
{
        TechRequired=largeElectrics
        entryCost=0
}
Umm...I just downloaded this pack, and half of the parts are missing. I only see the hublet and the limbs. Nothing else. Help!

I just cant creeate functional arm... joints rotate in strange direction, both horizontal and vertical same time...

Can someone post some idiot friendly tutorial for this?

Save this as DromoArm.craft and put it in your subassemblies folder.


ship = DromoArm
version = 0.22.0
description = DROMOMAN Arm
type = VAB

{
	part = DROMOMAN.lin.rotohub_4294084768
	partName = MuMechServo
	pos = -6.78504,0.04228401,-2.789984

Hi all! ZodiusInfuser's IR model rework reminded me that I have some unused models that I was intending to put in the pack update. I just never finished the texture work. A little late but yeah, I'm working on them =)

Here you can see the pitch joint, inline and at 90 degrees, and also an offset pitch joint inline and at full rotation.
That's just great! I wonder though, are you going to keep those in black? Because then they would not fit in with the existing parts very well :\

That's just great! I wonder though, are you going to keep those in black? Because then they would not fit in with the existing parts very well :\

No, this is a WIP texture, I have it darker to see the white scratches more clearly, I am still thinking on how to make them looking better. I will probably change textures of all parts.

Hi all! ZodiusInfuser's IR model rework reminded me that I have some unused models that I was intending to put in the pack update. I just never finished the texture work. A little late but yeah, I'm working on them =)

Here you can see the pitch joint, inline and at 90 degrees, and also an offset pitch joint inline and at full rotation.

Nothke, that is very good work you have there. And as a user of Dromoman, I am very excited to see prospects of an upcoming update .

No, this is a WIP texture, I have it darker to see the white scratches more clearly, I am still thinking on how to make them looking better. I will probably change textures of all parts.

One idea is to put in multiple colors, such as having both a darker and a white texture option. I feel like white will get used more often since it fits more in line with the stock parts, but it also would be nice to have some choice in the shade of color.

One idea is to put in multiple colors, such as having both a darker and a white texture option. I feel like white will get used more often since it fits more in line with the stock parts, but it also would be nice to have some choice in the shade of color.

Yeah, OR I could just make it compatible with KerbPaint, or maybe FS texture switcher.
